Disorder of kidney due to diabetes mellitus
insulin isophane human 70 UNT/ML / insulin regular human 30 UNT/ML Injectable Suspension [Humulin]
Inject 10 units subcutaneously before breakfast and 10 units before dinner
Amlodipine (as amlodipine besylate) 2.5 mg oral tablet
1 tablet (2.5 mg) by mouth once daily
1 tablet (25 mg) by mouth once daily
1 tablet (10 mg) by mouth once daily
Influenza virus antigen only vaccine product
Clostridium tetani toxoid antigen adsorbed only vaccine product
Live attenuated Human alphaherpesvirus 3 only vaccine product
Assessment of health and social care needs
Depression screening using Patient Health Questionnaire Two-Item score (procedure)
Depression screening using PHQ-9 (Patient Health Questionnaire 9) score

ul.li: Maintain blood pressure below 130/80 mmHg to reduce risk of cardiovascular and renal complications.
Achieve at least 5% reduction in body weight to improve blood pressure control.
Limit sodium intake to less than 2.3 grams per day to support blood pressure management.
Engage in at least 150 minutes per week of moderate-intensity aerobic physical activity.
Patient will participate in a diabetes self-management program to improve knowledge and skills for prediabetes management.
Patient will achieve a 5% reduction in baseline body weight to reduce risk of progression to diabetes.
Patient will maintain hemoglobin A1c below 6.5% to prevent progression to diabetes.
Patient will engage in at least 150 minutes per week of moderate-intensity physical activity.
Patient will follow a diet low in refined carbohydrates and saturated fats to support glycemic control.

Achieve at least 5% reduction in body weight to improve blood pressure control.
Limit sodium intake to less than 2.3 grams per day to support blood pressure management.
Engage in at least 150 minutes per week of moderate-intensity aerobic physical activity.
Patient will participate in a diabetes self-management program to improve knowledge and skills for prediabetes management.
Patient will achieve a 5% reduction in baseline body weight to reduce risk of progression to diabetes.
Patient will maintain hemoglobin A1c below 6.5% to prevent progression to diabetes.

Patient will follow a diet low in refined carbohydrates and saturated fats to support glycemic control.
